greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of inequivalent Golomb rulers with n marks and shortest length.
comment: A Golomb ruler of length n is a subset of {0...n} containing 0 and n and such that every pair of distinct terms has a different difference. For example, the a(2) = 1 through a(8) = 1 Golomb rulers are:
Also half the number of length-(n - 1) compositions of A003022(n) such that every consecutive subsequence has a different sum. For example, the a(2) = 1 through a(8) = 1 compositions are (A = 10):
link: Anonymous, In Search Of The Optimal 20, 21 and 22 Mark Golomb Rulers
J. B. Shearer, Table of known optimal Golomb rulers
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Golomb Ruler
